<tr>
<td valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in' width="960"> <p style='margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-left:8.65pt;text-indent:-8.65pt;'><font size=2>Thereafter</font></p> </td>
<td colspan=2 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in' width="66"> <p style='text-align:right;margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;' align="right"><font size=2>444,828</font></p> </td> </tr>
<tr>
<td valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in' width="960"> <p><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>
<td colspan=2 valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in' width="66"> <hr noshade width="100%" color="black" size=1> </td> </tr>
<tr>
<td valign=bottom style='background:#CCEEFF; padding:0in 0in 0in 0in' width="960"> <p style='margin-left:0.12in;text-indent:-0.12in;margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;' ><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>
<td colspan="2" valign=bottom style='background:#CCEEFF;padding: 0in 0in 0in 0in' width=66> <p style='text-align:right;margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;' ><font size=1></font><font size=2>$</font><font size=2>759,635</font></p> </td> </tr>
<tr>
<td valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in' width="960"> <p><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>
<td valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in' colspan="2" width="66"> <hr noshade width="100%" color="black" size=3> </td> </tr> </table> <br> <p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:6pt;'><b><font size=2>9.</font></b><font
size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><b><font size=2>Minority Interests in Operating Partnership:</font></b></u><b><font size=2> </font></b></p> <p style=' margin-bottom:0pt;
margin-top:8pt;'><font size=2>Minority interests in the accompanying Consolidated Balance Sheets represent both the common and preferred ownership interest in the Operating Partnership held by third parties. The common minority interest represents
common OP Units, which are convertible into an equivalent number of shares of the Company&#146;s common stock. As of December 31, 2002 and 2001, common minority interest was approximately 16% and 17%, respectively. </font></p> <p style='
margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:8pt;'><font size=2>Common OP Unitholders may convert their common OP Units into shares of common stock of the Company at a one for one exchange ratio. These transactions result in an increase of outstanding common
shares, and a corresponding decrease of outstanding OP Units, classified as minority interests in the Consolidated Balance Sheets. </font></p> <p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:8pt;'><font size=2>The following is a summary of activity of the
common minority interest in the Operating Partnership, including the transfer adjustment among the common minority interest and shareholders&#146; equity in the Consolidated Balance Sheets to account for the change in the respective ownership in the
underlying equity of the Operating Partnership. </font></p> <br><p style='margin-bottom:0pt;text-align:center'><font
size=2>45</font></p>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

SIZE=2>I</font><font SIZE=1>NC</font></b></p> <p style=' margin-bottom:0pt;text-align:center; margin-top:16pt;'><b><font SIZE=2>N</font><font SIZE=1>OTES </font><font SIZE=2>T</font><font SIZE=1>O </font><font SIZE=2>C</font><font SIZE=1>ONSOLIDATED
</font><font SIZE=2>F</font><font SIZE=1>INANCIAL </font><font SIZE=2>S</font><font SIZE=1>TATEMENTS</font><font size=2>, Continued</font></b></p> <p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;'>&nbsp;&nbsp;</p>

<td valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <hr noshade width="100%" color="black" size=3> </td>
<td valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <hr noshade width="100%" color="black" size=3> </td>
<td width=17 valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>
<td valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <hr noshade width="100%" color="black" size=3> </td>
<td valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <hr noshade width="100%" color="black" size=3> </td>
<td width=17 valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td> </tr> </table> <br> <br><p style='margin-bottom:0pt;text-align:center'><font
size=2>46</font></p>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>
 <p style=' margin-bottom:0pt;text-align:center; margin-top:16pt;'><b><font SIZE=2>C</font><font SIZE=1>HATEAU </font><font SIZE=2>C</font><font SIZE=1>OMMUNITIES</font><font size=2>,</font><font size=1> </font><font
SIZE=2>I</font><font SIZE=1>NC</font></b></p> <p style=' margin-bottom:0pt;text-align:center; margin-top:16pt;'><b><font SIZE=2>N</font><font SIZE=1>OTES </font><font SIZE=2>T</font><font SIZE=1>O </font><font SIZE=2>C</font><font SIZE=1>ONSOLIDATED
</font><font SIZE=2>F</font><font SIZE=1>INANCIAL </font><font SIZE=2>S</font><font SIZE=1>TATEMENTS</font><font size=2>, Continued</font></b></p> <p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:8pt;'><font size=2>The Company paid a dividend/distribution
of $.55 per common share/OP Unit on April 15, 2002; July 15, 2002; and October 15, 2002 to shareholders and OP Unitholders of record as of March 29, 2002; June 28, 2002; September 30, 2002, respectively. In addition, the Company declared a
dividend/distribution of $.55 per common share to shareholders and OP Unitholders of record as of January 15, 2003 to be paid January 31, 2003. These dividends are included in Dividends and distributions payable in the accompanying Consolidated
Balance Sheets as of December 31, 2002.</font></p> <p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:8pt;'><font size=2>The Company paid a dividend/distribution of $.545 per common share/OP Unit on April 16, 2001; July 16, 2001; October 15, 2001 and December
31, 2001 to shareholders and OP Unitholders of record as of March 30, 2001; June 29, 2001; and September 30, 2001 and December 15, 2001, respectively. </font></p> <p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:8pt;'><font size=2>The notes receivable from
stock option exercises bear interest, primarily at LIBOR plus 80 basis points, range in maturity dates from 2003 to 2005, are collateralized by the underlying common shares and are non-recourse to the borrower. In 2002, in connection with his
termination, the Company&#146;s Chief Executive Officer repaid his loan by surrendering the underlying common shares. As the value of the collateral was not sufficient to repay the balance of the loan, and the loans are non-recourse to the borrower,
the Company recognized approximately $300,000 of expense, which is included in Severance and related costs in the Consolidated Statements of Income.</font></p> <p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:8pt;'><font size=2>In 2000, the Company
repurchased 453,900 shares for approximately $11.3 million. </font></p> <p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:8pt;'><font size=2>Basic and diluted earnings per share (&#147;EPS&#148;) are summarized in the following table:</font></p> <p style='
margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;'>&nbsp;&nbsp;</p>

size=2>47</font></p>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>
 <p style=' margin-bottom:0pt;text-align:center; margin-top:16pt;'><b><font SIZE=2>C</font><font SIZE=1>HATEAU </font><font SIZE=2>C</font><font SIZE=1>OMMUNITIES</font><font size=2>,</font><font size=1> </font><font
SIZE=2>I</font><font SIZE=1>NC</font></b></p> <p style=' margin-bottom:0pt;text-align:center; margin-top:16pt;'><b><font SIZE=2>N</font><font SIZE=1>OTES </font><font SIZE=2>T</font><font SIZE=1>O </font><font SIZE=2>C</font><font SIZE=1>ONSOLIDATED
</font><font SIZE=2>F</font><font SIZE=1>INANCIAL </font><font SIZE=2>S</font><font SIZE=1>TATEMENTS</font><font size=2>, Continued</font></b></p> <p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:12pt;'><b><font size=2>11.</font></b><font
size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><b><font size=2>Comprehensive Income:</font></b></u><b><font size=2> </font></b></p> <p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:8pt;'><font size=2>In August 2001, the Company entered into a
forward interest rate swap agreement to hedge the anticipated issuance of $150 million of senior notes, which were issued in October 2001. The purpose of the swap was to hedge future interest rate payments on the fixed rate bonds to be issued. This
swap is accounted for as a cash flow hedge, in accordance with SFAS No. 133. In accordance with SFAS No. 133, the Company recorded a loss on the swap of approximately $7.1 million as of the date of the debt issuance in other comprehensive income,
which is included in the equity section of the Consolidated Balance Sheets. Under SFAS No. 133, the Company began amortizing the amounts in other comprehensive income related to this hedge once the debt was issued. </font></p> <p style='
margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:8pt;'><font size=2>Total comprehensive income for the year ended December 31, 2000 was equal to the net income. Total comprehensive income for the years ended December 31, 2002 and 2001 is summarized as follows (in
thousands):</font></p> <p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;'>&nbsp;&nbsp;</p>
<table width="100%" border=0 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 style='border-collapse:collapse; '>
<tr>
<td valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='text-align:center;margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;' ><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>
<td width=15 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='text-align:center;margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>

<tr>
<td valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;margin-left:8.65pt;text-indent:-8.65pt;'><font size=2>Total comprehensive income</font></p> </td>
<td width=15 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p ><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>
<td width=8 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='text-align:right;margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;' ><font size=2>$</font></p> </td>
<td width=39 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='text-align:right;margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;' ><font size=2>15,601</font></p> </td>
<td width=16 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p ><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>
<td width=8 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='text-align:right;margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;' ><font size=2>$</font></p> </td>
<td width=42 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='text-align:right;margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;' ><font size=2>19,597</font></p> </td>
<td width=15 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p ><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td> </tr>
<tr>
<td valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>
<td width=15 valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>
<td valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <hr noshade width="100%" color="black" size=3> </td>
<td valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <hr noshade width="100%" color="black" size=3> </td>
<td width=16 valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>
<td valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <hr noshade width="100%" color="black" size=3> </td>
<td valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <hr noshade width="100%" color="black" size=3> </td>
<td width=15 valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td> </tr> </table> <br> <p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:12pt;'><b><font size=2>12.</font></b><font
size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><b><font size=2>Stock Option Plans:</font></b></u><b><font size=2> </font></b></p> <p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:8pt;'><font size=2>The Company measures compensation cost using
the intrinsic value method, in accordance with Accounting Principles Board Opinion No. 25 (&#147;APB 25&#148;), &#147;Accounting for Stock Issued to Employees.&#148; </font></p> <p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:8pt;'><font size=2>The
Company&#146;s equity compensation plans, (collectively, the &#147;Plans&#148;) provide for the grant of approximately 5.0 million options and restricted stock awards. The compensation committee of the Board of Directors approves the awards and
determines the vesting schedule of each option and the term, which term shall not exceed ten years from the date of grant. </font></p> <p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:8pt;'><font size=2>During 2002, the shareholders approved the 2002 Equity
Compensation Plan, which allows for the issuance of up to 1.4 million shares of the Company&#146;s common stock to key employees, directors and key consultants.</font></p> <p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:8pt;'><font size=2>During 2001, the
Company&#146;s Board of Directors approved the 2001 Equity Compensation Plan and the CWS Equity Compensation Plan, which provides for up to 500,000 and 55,000, shares of common stock, respctively, that may be granted to key employees other than
directors and executive officers.</font></p> <p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:8pt;'><font size=2>Information concerning stock options is as follows: </font></p> <br><p style='margin-bottom:0pt;text-align:center'><font
size=2>48</font></p>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>

<td width=15 valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td> </tr> </table> <br> <p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.36in; text-indent:-0.36in; margin-top:3pt;'><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font
size=2>(1)</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font size=2>The options granted do not include the grant of 50,000 shares of restricted stock in 2000 to executive officers of the Company and 17,000 shares of restricted stock granted to
key employees of the Company in 2001. </font></p> <p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.36in; text-indent:-0.36in; margin-top:3pt;'><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font size=2>(2)</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font
size=2>For the years ended December 31, 2002, 2001 and 2000 approximately 1,384,000, 70,000 and 720,000 options, respectively, were considered anti-dilutive. </font></p> <p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.36in; text-indent:-0.36in;
margin-top:3pt;'><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font size=2>(3)</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font size=2>Options granted in 2001 includes 49,162 shares granted prior to 2001, but now included due to the CWS
merger.</font></p> <p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.36in; text-indent:-0.36in; margin-top:3pt;'><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font size=2>(4)</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font size=2>The options forfeited /
expired do not include the forfeiture of approximately 5,000 shares of restricted stock in 2002.</font></p> <p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:8pt;'><font size=2>For all options granted during 2002, 2001, and 2000, the weighted average
exercise price of the Company&#146;s stock options on the grant date was approximately equal to the weighted average market price of the Company&#146;s common stock. </font></p> <p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:8pt;'><font size=2>The
following table summarizes information concerning outstanding and exercisable options at December 31, 2002.</font></p> <p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;'>&nbsp;&nbsp;</p>

<td width=15 valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td> </tr> </table> <br> <p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:12pt;'><b><font size=2>13.</font></b><font
size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><b><font size=2>Savings Plan:</font></b></u></p> <p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:8pt;'><font size=2>The Company has a qualified retirement plan designed to qualify under Section 401
of the Internal Revenue Code (the &#147;Savings Plan&#148;). The Savings Plan allows employees of the Company and its subsidiaries to defer a portion of their compensation on a pre-tax basis subject to certain maximum amounts. Contributions by the
Company are discretionary and determined by the Company&#146;s management. Company contributions are allocated to each participant based on the relative compensation of the participant to the compensation of all participants. The Company contributed
approximately $350,000, $250,000, and $500,000 for the Plan years ended December 31, 2002, 2001, and 2000, respectively. </font></p> <p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:12pt;'><b><font size=2>14.</font></b><font
size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><b><font size=2>Related Party Transactions:</font></b></u></p> <p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:8pt;'><font size=2>Rental expense of approximately $130,000 annually has been incurred
for leased space in an office building owned by certain officers and equity owners. </font></p> <p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:8pt;'><font size=2>Included in management fee and other income and interest income are amounts earned from
N&#146;Tandem, as outlined below:</font></p> <p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;'>&nbsp;</p>
<table width="100%" border=0 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 style='border-collapse:collapse; '>
<tr>
<td valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='text-align:center;margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;' ><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>
<td width=16 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='text-align:center;margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>
<td colspan=2 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='text-align:center;margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;'><b><font size=1>2002</font></b></p> </td>
<td width=14 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='text-align:center;margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>
<td colspan=2 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='text-align:center;margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;'><b><font size=1>2001</font></b></p> </td>
<td width=15 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='text-align:center;margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>

<td width=15 valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td> </tr> </table> <br> <p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:8pt;'><font size=2>Interest is earned on the loan to N&#146;Tandem (Prime plus one percent,
or 5.25% at December 31, 2002) and includes fees paid by N&#146;Tandem for the subordination of the loan to the Company, approximately $310,000 in 2002, and $730,000 in 2001 and 2000. The transaction fees are related to acquisition services provided
by the Company to N&#146;Tandem and are calculated as three percent of the acquisition price. The advisory fees are charged based on one percent of N&#146;Tandem&#146;s average assets. The management fees are charged based on five percent of
revenues of properties managed by the Company on behalf of N&#146;Tandem. Overhead reimbursement fees were based on a fixed fee per site in 2001 and 2000 and a specific allocation of costs in 2002.</font></p> <br><p
style='margin-bottom:0pt;text-align:center'><font size=2>
50</font></p>
<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<h5 align="left"><a href="#toc">Table of Contents</a></h5>
 <p style=' margin-bottom:0pt;text-align:center; margin-top:16pt;'><b><font SIZE=2>C</font><font SIZE=1>HATEAU </font><font SIZE=2>C</font><font SIZE=1>OMMUNITIES</font><font size=2>,</font><font size=1> </font><font
SIZE=2>I</font><font SIZE=1>NC</font></b></p> <p style=' margin-bottom:0pt;text-align:center; margin-top:16pt;'><b><font SIZE=2>N</font><font SIZE=1>OTES </font><font SIZE=2>T</font><font SIZE=1>O </font><font SIZE=2>C</font><font SIZE=1>ONSOLIDATED
</font><font SIZE=2>F</font><font SIZE=1>INANCIAL </font><font SIZE=2>S</font><font SIZE=1>TATEMENTS</font><font size=2>, Continued</font></b></p> <p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:8pt;'><font size=2>In connection with the CWS acquisition,
the Company became a party to several agreements with the previous CWS principals. One of those principals is now a director of the Company (See Note 4). These agreements provide for tax protection to this director in the event of a disposition of
certain CWS properties. During 2002, the Company recognized approximately $185,000 of expense related to this agreement. In addition, there is a development agreement that provides for participation in the proceeds from the sale or development of
one property.</font></p> <p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:12pt;'><b><font size=2>15.</font></b><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><b><font size=2>Contingencies:</font></b></u></p> <p style=' margin-bottom:0pt;
margin-top:8pt;'><font size=2>Several claims and legal actions arising from the normal course of business have been asserted against the Company, and are pending final resolution. In the opinion of management, none of these matters will have a
material adverse effect upon the results of operations, financial condition or cash flows of the Company. </font></p> <p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:8pt;'><font size=2>The Company, through its joint venture and affiliate arrangements, has
guaranteed approximately $35 million of debt, which consist mainly of a $16.5 million unsecured line of credit for N&#146;Tandem and $17.9 million secured debt for an affiliate and an entity for which the Company holds a note receivable.</font></p>
<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:8pt;'><font size=2>When CSI sells homes, the purchaser may obtain financing from Vanderbilt Mortgage and Finance, Inc. (&#147;Vanderbilt&#148;). In certain cases, for homes sold before June 1998, Vanderbilt
has recourse to the Company if the loans are not repaid. As of December 31, 2002 there is a total of approximately $9.3 million of such amounts that are recourse to the Company. </font></p> <p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:12pt;'><b><font
size=2>16.</font></b><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><b><font size=2>Subsequent Event:</font></b></u></p> <p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:8pt;'><font size=2>In January 2003, the Company signed an agreement
to purchase a subsidiary of N&#146;Tandem. The total purchase price is approximately $150 million and will require a $5 million additional investment. In addition, the Company will assume $85 million of secured debt and $3 million of other
liabilities; payoff N&#146;Tandem&#146;s $16.5 million line of credit, which the Company currently guarantees (see note 15); and retire the loans and advances to N&#146;Tandem, of approximately $38 million. The transaction is subject to customary
closing conditions, including approval by the shareholders of N&#146;Tandem, and is expected to close in the second quarter of 2003. </font></p> <p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:12pt;'><b><font size=2>17.</font></b><font
size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><b><font size=2>Tax Information (Unaudited):</font></b></u></p> <p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:8pt;'><font size=2>The Company is providing this information as required by the Code.
The amounts shown may differ from those elsewhere in this report because of differences between tax and financial reporting requirements. The distributions to shareholders included $13,526,000 from long-term capital gains.</font></p> <p style='
margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:12pt;'><b><font size=2>18.</font></b><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><u><b><font size=2>Quarterly Financial Information (Unaudited):</font></b></u></p> <p style=' margin-bottom:0pt;
margin-top:8pt;'><font size=2>The following is quarterly financial information for the years ended December 31, 2002 and 2001.</font><br><font size=2>(amounts in thousands, except per share data)</font></p> <br><p
style='margin-bottom:0pt;text-align:center'><font size=2>
51</font></p>

<td width=9 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p ><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>
<td width=8 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='text-align:right;margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;' ><font size=2>$</font></p> </td>
<td width=38 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='text-align:right;margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;' ><font size=2>0.33</font></p> </td>
<td width=9 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p ><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>

<td width=62 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='text-align:right;margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;' ><font size=2>0.32</font></p> </td>

<td width=64 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='text-align:right;margin-top:2pt;margin-bottom:0pt;' ><font size=2>(0.03</font></p> </td>
<td width=16 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p ><font size=2>)</font></p> </td> </tr>
<tr>
<td valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>
<td width=9 valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>
<td valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <hr noshade width="100%" color="black" size=3> </td>
<td valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <hr noshade width="100%" color="black" size=3> </td>
<td width=9 valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>

<td width=16 valign=top style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td> </tr> </table> <br> <p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.36in; margin-top:8pt;'><font size=2>Note: Quarterly amounts differ from previously
reported amounts due to discontinued operations and other reclassifications. As there was no change to net income, no reconciliation is necessary.</font></p> <p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.36in; text-indent:-0.36in;
margin-top:3pt;'><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font size=2>(a)</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font size=2>Operating income represents total revenues less property operating and maintenance expense, real estate taxes and
administrative expense. Operating income is a measure of the performance of the properties before the effects of depreciation and interest and related amortization costs. </font></p> <p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.36in;
text-indent:-0.36in; margin-top:3pt;'><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font size=2>(b)</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font size=2>Quarterly earnings per common share amounts may not total to the annual amounts due to rounding and
to the change in the number of common shares outstanding. </font></p> <p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.36in; text-indent:-0.36in; margin-top:3pt;'><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font size=2>(c)</font><font
size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font size=2>The cumulative effect of accounting change was determined in the third quarter of 2002 and recorded in the first quarter of 2002.</font></p> <br><p style='margin-bottom:0pt;text-align:center'><font
size=2>
52</font></p>

<a name="tx766_15">Controls and Procedures</a></font></b></u></p> <p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:8pt;'><font size=2>We maintain a system of disclosure controls and procedures. The term &#147;disclosure controls and procedures,&#148; as
defined by the regulations of the Securities and Exchange Commission (&#147;SEC&#148;), means controls and other procedures that are designed to ensure that information required to be disclosed in the reports that we file or submit to the SEC under
the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (the &#147;Act&#148;), is recorded, processed, summarized and reported, within the time periods specified in the SEC&#146;s rules and forms. Disclosure controls and procedures include, without
limitation, controls and procedures designed to ensure that information required to be disclosed by us in the reports that we file or submit to the SEC under the Act is accumulated and communicated to our management, including our principal
executive officer and our principal financial officer, as appropriate to allow timely decisions to be made regarding required disclosure. The Chief Executive Officer and Chief Financial Officer have evaluated our disclosure controls and procedures
as of a date within 90 days of the filing date of this Form 10-K and have concluded that our disclosure controls and procedures are effective as of the date of such evaluation.</font></p> <p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:12pt;'><b><font
SIZE=2>PART IV</font></b></p> <p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.75in; text-indent:-0.75in; margin-top:12pt;'><u><b><font size=2>Item 15.</font></b></u><font

proxy statement (filed or to be filed pursuant to Regulation 14A) for its Annual Meeting of Shareholders to be held on May 15, 2003.</font></p> <br><p style='margin-bottom:0pt;text-align:center'><font size=2>

 <p style=' margin-bottom:0pt;text-align:center; margin-top:16pt;'><b><font size=2>Sarbanes-Oxley &sect;302(a) Certification</font></b></p> <p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:8pt;'><font size=2>I, Rees F. Davis
Jr., certify that:</font></p> <p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.36in; text-indent:-0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>1)</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font size=2>I have reviewed this annual
report on Form 10-K of Chateau Communities, Inc.;</font></p> <p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.36in; text-indent:-0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>2)</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font
size=2>Based on my knowledge, this annual report does not contain any untrue statement of a material fact or omit to state a material fact necessary to make the statements made, in light of the circumstances under which such statements were made,
not misleading with respect to the period covered by this annual report;</font></p> <p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.36in; text-indent:-0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>3)</font><font
size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font size=2>Based on my knowledge, the financial statements, and other financial information included in this annual report, fairly present in all material respects, the financial
condition, results of operations and cash flows of the registrant as of, and for, the periods presented in this annual report;</font></p> <p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.36in; text-indent:-0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font
size=2>4)</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font size=2>The registrant&#146;s other certifying officers and I am responsible for establishing and maintaining disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in
Exchange Act Rules 13a-14 and 15d-14) for the registrant and we have:</font></p> <p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.72in; text-indent:-0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>a.</font><font
size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font size=2>Designed such disclosure controls and procedures to ensure that material information relating to the registrant, including its consolidated subsidiaries, is made known
to us by others within those entities, particularly during the period in which this quarterly report is being prepared;</font></p> <p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.72in; text-indent:-0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>b.</font><font
size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font size=2>Evaluated the effectiveness of the registrant&#146;s disclosure controls and procedures as of a date within 90 days prior to the filing date of this annual report (the
&#147;Evaluation Date&#148;); and</font></p> <p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.72in; text-indent:-0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>c.</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font
size=2>Presented in this quarterly report our conclusions about the effectiveness of the disclosure controls and procedures based on our evaluation as of the Evaluation Date;</font></p> <p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.36in;
text-indent:-0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>5)</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font size=2>The registrant&#146;s other certifying officers and I have disclosed, based on our most recent evaluation,
to the registrant&#146;s auditors and the audit committee of registrant&#146;s board of directors (or persons performing the equivalent function):</font></p> <p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.72in; text-indent:-0.36in;
margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>d.</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font size=2>All significant deficiencies in the design or operation of internal controls which could adversely affect the registrant&#146;s
ability to record, process, summarize and report financial data and have identified for the registrant&#146;s auditors any material weaknesses in internal controls; and</font></p> <p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.72in;
text-indent:-0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>e.</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font size=2>Any fraud, whether or not material, that involves management or other employees who have a significant
role in the registrant&#146;s internal controls; and</font></p> <p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.36in; text-indent:-0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>6)</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font
size=2>The registrant&#146;s other certifying officers and I have indicated in this annual report whether or not there were significant changes in internal controls or in other factors that could significantly affect internal controls subsequent to
the date of our most recent evaluation, including any corrective actions with regard to significant deficiencies and material weakness.</font></p> <p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;'>&nbsp;</p>

 <p style=' margin-bottom:0pt;text-align:center; margin-top:16pt;'><b><font size=2>Sarbanes-Oxley &sect;302(a) Certification</font></b></p> <p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>I, Tamara D.
Fischer, certify that:</font></p> <p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.36in; text-indent:-0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>1)</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font size=2>I have reviewed this
annual report on Form 10-K of Chateau Communities, Inc.;</font></p> <p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.36in; text-indent:-0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>2)</font><font
size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font size=2>Based on my knowledge, this annual report does not contain any untrue statement of a material fact or omit to state a material fact necessary to make the statements made, in
light of the circumstances under which such statements were made, not misleading with respect to the period covered by this annual report;</font></p> <p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.36in; text-indent:-0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font
size=2>3)</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font size=2>Based on my knowledge, the financial statements, and other financial information included in this annual report, fairly present in all material
respects, the financial condition, results of operations and cash flows of the registrant as of, and for, the periods presented in this annual report;</font></p> <p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.36in; text-indent:-0.36in;
margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>4)</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font size=2>The registrant&#146;s other certifying officers and I am responsible for establishing and maintaining disclosure controls and
procedures (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-14 and 15d-14) for the registrant and we have:</font></p> <p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.72in; text-indent:-0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>f.</font><font
size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font size=2>Designed such disclosure controls and procedures to ensure that material information relating to the registrant, including its consolidated subsidiaries, is made known
to us by others within those entities, particularly during the period in which this quarterly report is being prepared;</font></p> <p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.72in; text-indent:-0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>g.</font><font
size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font size=2>Evaluated the effectiveness of the registrant&#146;s disclosure controls and procedures as of a date within 90 days prior to the filing date of this annual report (the
&#147;Evaluation Date&#148;); and</font></p> <p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.72in; text-indent:-0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>h.</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font size=2>Presented in
this quarterly report our conclusions about the effectiveness of the disclosure controls and procedures based on our evaluation as of the Evaluation Date;</font></p> <p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.36in; text-indent:-0.36in;
margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>5)</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font size=2>The registrant&#146;s other certifying officers and I have disclosed, based on our most recent evaluation, to the
registrant&#146;s auditors and the audit committee of registrant&#146;s board of directors (or persons performing the equivalent function):</font></p> <p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.72in; text-indent:-0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font
size=2>i.</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font size=2>All significant deficiencies in the design or operation of internal controls which could adversely affect the registrant&#146;s ability to record,
process, summarize and report financial data and have identified for the registrant&#146;s auditors any material weaknesses in internal controls; and</font></p> <p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.72in; text-indent:-0.36in;
margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>j.</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font size=2>Any fraud, whether or not material, that involves management or other employees who have a significant role in the
registrant&#146;s internal controls; and</font></p> <p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-left:0.36in; text-indent:-0.36in; margin-top:6pt;'><font size=2>6)</font><font size=1>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</font><font size=2>The
registrant&#146;s other certifying officers and I have indicated in this annual report whether or not there were significant changes in internal controls or in other factors that could significantly affect internal controls subsequent to the date of
our most recent evaluation, including any corrective actions with regard to significant deficiencies and material weakness.</font></p> <p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;'>&nbsp;&nbsp;</p>
<table align=center border=0 cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 style='border-collapse:collapse; '>
<tr>
<td width=307 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0in;'><font size=2>Date: March 28, 2003</font></p> </td>
<td width=46 valign=bottom style='padding:0in 0in 0in 0in'> <p style='margin-bottom:0pt;margin-top:0in;'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>

                            CHATEAU COMMUNITIES, INC.

                          2002 EQUITY COMPENSATION PLAN
